course.title: North Korea as History and Crisis
course.description: Explores the historical context of the present crisis on the Korean peninsula and engages students in current debates about the crisis from a variety of different official, institutional, and popular perspectives, including those of North and South Korea, the United States, China, Japan, Russia, and other concerned parties, such as the United Nations. Students encouraged to develop own perspectives on resolving crisis. Examines role of historical forces in shaping the crisis and its possible resolution.
